entry.title: First Meeting This Friday at 1:00pm
entry.summary:
In our first organizational meeting, Thomas discussed the schedule for the spring semester, 2023. Jeff will take over as the faculty organizer and Jack remains the student organizer for this semester.

Please note that, in the future meetings, we will be meeting at 1:30 pm on Fridays, instead of …
entry.content:
In our first organizational meeting, Thomas discussed the schedule for the spring semester, 2023. Jeff will take over as the faculty organizer and Jack remains the student organizer for this semester.

Please note that, in the future meetings, we will be meeting at 1:30 pm on Fridays, instead of 1:00 pm!

entry.content:
In our first organizational meeting, Thomas discussed the schedule for the spring semester, 2023. Jeff will take over as the faculty organizer and Jack remains the student organizer for this semester.

Please note that, in the future meetings, we will be meeting at 1:30 pm on Fridays, instead of 1:00 pm!

entry.title: Jeff on (reverse) definite languages this Friday (Dec 2)
entry.summary:
Jeff will give a presentation this Friday (Dec 2) about definite and reverse definite languages and generalizations thereof. This will be our last MLRG meeting for this semester. Hope to see you all there!

Note: The meeting will again take place at the seminar room (SBS S-207), instead of the …
entry.content:
Jeff will give a presentation this Friday (Dec 2) about definite and reverse definite languages and generalizations thereof. This will be our last MLRG meeting for this semester. Hope to see you all there!

Note: The meeting will again take place at the seminar room (SBS S-207), instead of the compling lab.

entry.title: No meetings for the next three weeks
entry.content: Unless otherwise stated, we will not be meeting for the next three weeks due to no presenters and the Thanksgiving break. We will meet again on Dec 2 for Magda's presentation (topic to be announced).

entry.title: Scott on Modal Logic & the phon(etics/ology) interface (Nov 4)
entry.content: Scott will be talking about "Modal Logic & the phon(etics/ology) interface" this Friday. We will still be meeting this Friday at 1:00 pm as usual, but due to lab renovations, we will relocate. The meeting location is still to be announced.

entry.title: No meeting next Friday (Oct 28)
entry.summary:
Due to the lab renovations, we will not be meeting next Friday (Oct 28). Our weekly recreational meeting will resume on Nov 4 and Scott will talk about "Modal Logic & the phon(etics/ology) interface". Stay tuned!

Currently, we do not have any speakers for Nov 11 and 18, as …
entry.content:
Due to the lab renovations, we will not be meeting next Friday (Oct 28). Our weekly recreational meeting will resume on Nov 4 and Scott will talk about "Modal Logic & the phon(etics/ology) interface". Stay tuned!

Currently, we do not have any speakers for Nov 11 and 18, as can be seen in Schedule. If you have anything to present, feel free to shoot an email to Jack (zhengxiang.wang@stonybrook.edu).

entry.title: No meeting next Friday (Oct 21)
entry.summary: There will be no meeting next Friday (Oct 21). You are encouraged to attend the talk titled " Building better speech recognition for everyone" given by alumnus Alëna Aksënova. Alëna is a linguist at Google, where she works on topics related to speech processing, automatic speech recognition, and model evaluation pipelines …
entry.content:
There will be no meeting next Friday (Oct 21). You are encouraged to attend the talk titled " Building better speech recognition for everyone" given by alumnus Alëna Aksënova. Alëna is a linguist at Google, where she works on topics related to speech processing, automatic speech recognition, and model evaluation pipelines. The talk will take place at 1:00PM next Friday at IACS seminar room.

More information about the talk and Alëna can be found here.

entry.title: Thomas on Monotonicity in Syntax next Friday (Oct 14)
entry.summary:
This time Thomas will present recent work of his on monotonicity in syntax. He claims that monotonicity provides a unified view on the Ban Against Improper Movement, the Williams Cycle, and freezing effects. We'll see if he can convince us.

If you have time, you can try to read the …
entry.content:
This time Thomas will present recent work of his on monotonicity in syntax. He claims that monotonicity provides a unified view on the Ban Against Improper Movement, the Williams Cycle, and freezing effects. We'll see if he can convince us.

If you have time, you can try to read the related paper before the meeting to get a preview.
